Using CloudantDB in Node-RED
info:
This is a simple flow that tests storing and retrieving documents from a 
Cloudant database. It is borrowed from this tutorial by Dave Krier:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FXm2Bk-tCIc

It uses "node-red-node-cf-cloudant" Cloudant nodes which are documented
here:
http://flows.nodered.org/node/node-red-node-cf-cloudant

You can sign up for a free Cloudant database here:
https://cloudant.com/

After signing up you should create a database then click on the
"Permissions" tab to create a user. Click the "Generate API Key" button
and record the key and password values.

Configure the Cloudant nodes by entering the path to the Cloudant database 
in the Host field. The key and password should be entered in the 
Username and Password fields. Enter the database name in the Database field.

Deploy your Node-red flow and open another browser tab to execute
create, read and bulk delete operations:

(1) To insert documents use commands of this type:
http://localhost:1880/putdata?name=graham&age=29

(2) To retrieve documents:
http://localhost:1880/getdata

(3) To delete ALL documents:
http://localhost:1880/deleteall

TODO - find a more efficient way to delete all the documents.

name: Rules
format:
Welcome to A.I.R

Please note:
1. Fill the form below and click submit.
2. Upload your resume in .pdf format.
3. Click 'Next' button.

name: BG2
format:
Welcome to Technical Round

Please note:
1. Hit Enter button to respond
2. Each segment has 3 questions with 4 options each.
3. Answer only with the option number(1/2/3/4).
4. Every right answer is awarded 1 mark(no negative marking).
5. Passing criteria is 6 marks.
6. Click on Next after finishing.

Assestment Round

Please note:
1. Answer the following questions with minimum 50 words each.
2. Click the submit button to submit the test.
